Python.name: Python
Python.brief: General Programming Language with specialism in Data Science and Machine Learning

Javascript.name: Javascript
Javascript.brief: General Programming Language with specialism in event-driven computation such as websites

Typescript.name: Typescript
Typescript.brief: Static type system; superset of Javascript that compiles to Javascript at build time

SQL.name: SQL
SQL.brief: Structured Query Language, used to query databases

Redis.name: Redis
Redis.brief: In-Memory Data Structure Store, used to store data in memory for fast access

AWS.name: AWS
AWS.brief: Leading Cloud Platform from Amazon, used to build systems and applications via cloud compute

D3.name: D3 js
D3.brief: Data Visualisation Library based on Javascript, allows for custom-made eye catching interactive visuals on websites

Django.name: Django
Django.brief: Full-fledged Backend Framework for building web applications with batteries included

Flask.name: Flask
Flask.brief: Micro Backend Framework for building web applications

Socket.io.name: Socket.io
Socket.io.brief: Real-Time bi-directional event-based communication library, useful for building real-time applications

Framer Motion.name: Framer Motion
Framer Motion.brief: Javascript Framework to implement complex animations and transitions

Html.name: Html 5
Html.brief: Mark up Language used to produce websites, the bones of the web

CSS.name: CSS
CSS.brief: Cascading Style Sheet, used to style HTML documents, the skin of the web

Jupyter.name: Jupyter
Jupyter.brief: IDE for python specialised in Data Visualisation/Analysis

Pydantic.name: Pydantic
Pydantic.brief: Data Validation using Python type annotations, useful for building robust applications

Apache spark.name: Apache spark
Apache spark.brief: Big Data Processing Framework, useful for processing large amounts of data

PySpark.name: PySpark
PySpark.brief: the python version of Apache Spark, useful for processing large amounts of data

Plotly.name: Plotly
Plotly.brief: Interactive Graphing Library for both Python and Javascript

Keras.name: Keras
Keras.brief: Deep Learning Framework built on top of tensorflow, provides a layer of abstraction to make building well known neural networks very easy

Linux.name: Linux
Linux.brief: Open-Source operating system typically used for cloud computing/Back-end systems.

Docker.name: Docker
Docker.brief: Containerisation Software, useful for building and deploying applications

Excel.name: Excel
Excel.brief: Tabular software allowing for quick analysis and visualisation

Power-BI.name: Power-BI
Power-BI.brief: Data visualisation software allowing for the easy creation of interactive visuals whilst also providing tools for data analysis via the DAX Language

Numpy.name: Numpy
Numpy.brief: Library aimed at efficient manipulation of Data arrays, especially useful for data analysis

Nuxt.name: Nuxt
Nuxt.brief: Framework allowing Vue to be used as a Universal application rather than a SPA; Greatly improves SEO

Next js.name: NextJS
Next js.brief: Javascript Framework for building server-side rendered (SSR) React applications; Greatly improves SEO

OpenCV.name: OpenCV
OpenCV.brief: Allows for efficient operations & more such as deep learning on images, videos, etc...

Pandas.name: Pandas
Pandas.brief: Built on top of Numpy, allows to work with tables, I refer to it as excel on steroids

PostgreSQL.name: PostgreSQL
PostgreSQL.brief: Relational database using the SQL language

Pytorch.name: Pytorch
Pytorch.brief: Deep learning framework built by Facebook, specialised in building unique/new neural networks

Scikit-Learn.name: Scikit-Learn
Scikit-Learn.brief: Machine Learning framework, allows for the creation of efficient data pipelines

Seaborn.name: Seaborn
Seaborn.brief: Built on top of Matplotlib, provides a layer of abstraction to make nice statistical graphs easier to produce

Selenium.name: Selenium
Selenium.brief: Framework with the ability to automate browsers, useful in automating extracting/downloading data from websites on a regular basis

Playwright.name: Playwright
Playwright.brief: Framework for automating web browsers, useful in automating extracting/downloading data from websites on a regular basis

Tensorflow.name: Tensorflow
Tensorflow.brief: Deep learning framework built by Google, specialised in building vast neural networks fast

Vue.name: Vue
Vue.brief: Javascript Framework to build reactive single page application websites

React.name: React
React.brief: Javascript Framework to build reactive single page application websites built by facebook

React Native.name: React Native
React Native.brief: Javascript Framework to build cross platform mobile applications using React

Tailwind css.name: Tailwind css
Tailwind css.brief: utility based CSS framework that allows for the quick creation of customisable websites

Express js.name: Express js
Express js.brief: Javascript Framework for building server-side applications

Node js.name: NodeJS
Node js.brief: Javascript runtime environment that allows the use of javascript as a backend language

Three js.name: ThreeJS
Three js.brief: Javascript framework for rendering 3D Scenes/Objects in the browser using WebGL (javascript api that provides access to the computers GPU)

Recharts.name: Recharts
Recharts.brief: interactive Charting Library for React; Built on top of D3.js
